trans-unit.source: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to scale web, mobile, api and logic apps in Azure App Service, including autoscaling.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to scale web, mobile, api and logic apps in Azure App Service, including autoscaling.

trans-unit.source: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale pricing tier in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: For increased performance and throughput for your apps on Microsoft Azure, you can use the Azure Portal to scale up your App Service plan from Free to Shared, Basic, Standard, ou Premium.
trans-unit.target: For increased performance and throughput for your apps on Microsoft Azure, you can use the Azure Portal to scale up your App Service plan from Free to Shared, Basic, Standard, ou Premium.

trans-unit.source: The level of service your App Service plan has is based on the <link><linkText>*Pricing tier* for the plan</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The level of service your App Service plan has is based on the <link><linkText>*Pricing tier* for the plan</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Higher pricing tiers, like Standard et Premium, offer greater robustness and flexibility in determining how your resources on Azure are used.
trans-unit.target: Higher pricing tiers, like Standard et Premium, offer greater robustness and flexibility in determining how your resources on Azure are used.

trans-unit.source: Changing the pricing tier affects the number of cores and amount of memory your service has, and this is referred to as Scaling up (or Scaling down).
trans-unit.target: Changing the pricing tier affects the number of cores and amount of memory your service has, and this is referred to as Scaling up (or Scaling down).

trans-unit.source: In addition to scaling up the pricing tier, you can increase the number of instances that you service has.
trans-unit.target: In addition to scaling up the pricing tier, you can increase the number of instances that you service has.

trans-unit.source: This is referred to as Scaling out ou Scaling in.
trans-unit.target: This is referred to as Scaling out ou Scaling in.

trans-unit.source: See the article on Scale instance count manually or automatically to learn more about Scale out et Scale in.
trans-unit.target: See the article on Scale instance count manually or automatically to learn more about Scale out et Scale in.

trans-unit.source: For information about App Service plans, see <link><linkText>What is an App Service Plan?</linkText><title></title></link> et <link><linkText>Azure App Service Plans In-Depth Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about App Service plans, see <link><linkText>What is an App Service Plan?</linkText><title></title></link> et <link><linkText>Azure App Service Plans In-Depth Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For information the pricing and features of individual App Service plans, see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information the pricing and features of individual App Service plans, see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.

trans-unit.source: REMARQUE] Before switching a from the Free mode to Basic, Standard, ou Premium mode, you must first remove the spending caps in place for your Azure App Service subscription.
trans-unit.target: REMARQUE] Before switching a from the Free mode to Basic, Standard, ou Premium mode, you must first remove the spending caps in place for your Azure App Service subscription.

trans-unit.source: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Subscriptions[azuresubscriptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To view or change options for your Microsoft Azure App Service subscription, see <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Subscriptions[azuresubscriptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scaling your pricing tier
trans-unit.target: Scaling your pricing tier

trans-unit.source: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link> and browse to the app you want to scale.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, open the <link><linkText>Azure Portal[portal]</linkText><title></title></link> and browse to the app you want to scale.

trans-unit.source: In the Essentials for your app, click the App Service plan/pricing tier link.
trans-unit.target: In the Essentials for your app, click the App Service plan/pricing tier link.

trans-unit.source: Click Pricing tier, then you will see the list of possible service levels for your plan.
trans-unit.target: Click Pricing tier, then you will see the list of possible service levels for your plan.

trans-unit.source: Each tier is accompanied by an estimated price, to give you a sense of the average cost for that tier.
trans-unit.target: Each tier is accompanied by an estimated price, to give you a sense of the average cost for that tier.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Choose Plan</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Choose Plan</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once you choose your tier, click Select.
trans-unit.target: Once you choose your tier, click Select.

trans-unit.source: Le Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete.
trans-unit.target: Le Notifications tab will flash a green SUCCESS once the operation is complete.

trans-unit.source: Scaling related resources
trans-unit.target: Scaling related resources

trans-unit.source: If your app depends on other services, such as SQL or Storage, you can also scale those based on your needs.
trans-unit.target: If your app depends on other services, such as SQL or Storage, you can also scale those based on your needs.

trans-unit.source: In the Essentials, click the Resource group link.
trans-unit.target: In the Essentials, click the Resource group link.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the Résumé part of the resource group blade, clicked one of the databases (or any other resource you want to scale).
trans-unit.target: Then, in the Résumé part of the resource group blade, clicked one of the databases (or any other resource you want to scale).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Linked database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linked database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On that linked resource blade, click the Pricing tier part, select one of the tiers based on your performance requirements, and click Select.
trans-unit.target: On that linked resource blade, click the Pricing tier part, select one of the tiers based on your performance requirements, and click Select.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale your SQL Database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale your SQL Database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If your app uses Storage, geo replication is automatically set up when you choose a pricing tier that supports it.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses Storage, geo replication is automatically set up when you choose a pricing tier that supports it.

trans-unit.source: For SQL, on the other hand, you need to manually configure geo-replication to increase the high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of your SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: For SQL, on the other hand, you need to manually configure geo-replication to increase the high availability and disaster recovery capabilities of your SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click the Geo Replication part.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click the Geo Replication part.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set up geo-replication for SQL Database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set up geo-replication for SQL Database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Developer Features
trans-unit.target: Developer Features

trans-unit.source: Depending on the pricing tier, the following developer-oriented features are available:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the pricing tier, the following developer-oriented features are available:

trans-unit.source: Bitness
trans-unit.target: Bitness

trans-unit.source: Le Basic, Standard, et Premium tiers support 64-bit and 32-bit applications.
trans-unit.target: Le Basic, Standard, et Premium tiers support 64-bit and 32-bit applications.

trans-unit.source: Le Free et Shared plan tier support 32-bit applications only.
trans-unit.target: Le Free et Shared plan tier support 32-bit applications only.

trans-unit.source: Debugger Support
trans-unit.target: Debugger Support

trans-unit.source: Debugger support is available for the Free, Shared, et Basic modes at 1 concurrent connection per App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Debugger support is available for the Free, Shared, et Basic modes at 1 concurrent connection per App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: Debugger support is available for the Standard et Premium modes at 5 concurrent connections per App Service plan.
trans-unit.target: Debugger support is available for the Standard et Premium modes at 5 concurrent connections per App Service plan.

trans-unit.source: Other Features
trans-unit.target: Other Features

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about all of the remaining features in the App Service plans, including pricing and features of interest to all users (including developers), see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about all of the remaining features in the App Service plans, including pricing and features of interest to all users (including developers), see <link><linkText>App Service Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.

trans-unit.source: REMARQUE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: REMARQUE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.
